Shitty Wizards • Beast Husbands • Men Who Cry At The Drop Of A Hat

about • art tag • art blog

please don't tag me in or ask me about the filming of Star Wars Ep IX, I don't want to know even the slightest spoilers about it, and I know less than you do

tags: i dislike it when people who have never thought about this character try to tell me about his story
summary: My fave is when people talk about Kylo saving Rey’s life as if saving a innocent person’s life and throwing down an evil despot...
body:
My fave is when people talk about Kylo saving Rey’s life as if saving a innocent person’s life and throwing down an evil despot is the most heinous, manipulative, evil, and selfish act he could have possibly done there, on par with (or worse than) murdering his father. He’s truly beyond the pale now! It’s very funny, if confusing.

I guess it’s another thing where people are looking at him as a master manipulator instead of the Painfully, Painfully Earnest character he actually is. I was trying to watch the movies yesterday that way (like, thinking he was tricking Han to get his guard down instead of a child earnestly asking a father’s help in performing a dark deed he thinks will stop the pain) and it was hard to think of it that way. I guess people really do, though.

summary: Sanity is a lie

description:
by regnaobscura

The Lars were dead. Obi-Wan raised Luke on Tatooine, while dealing with his demons.

summary: Friendship Test 2: The Book of Love and Friendship
title: Friendship Test 2: The Book of Love and Friendship
description:
by Aggimagination

The sequel of ‘Friendship test’, 10 years later. One year later, after their last wager, La Muerte and Xibalba set another wager of which of them has the right opinion about humans/mortals. The unexpected wager gone crazy when a mortal human girl from another world came, and turned the Land of the Forgotten upside down.

Words: 1697, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Book of Life (2014), Penguins of Madagascar, The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993), Winnie-the-Pooh - All Media Types, Fairly OddParents, Powerpuff Girls, Angry Birds - All Media Types, A.N.T. blog.description: UK based. Connoisseur of pop culture. Enthusiast of good things. Lover of Sci-fi & Fantasy. Devotee of contemporary, fantastical, comic & vintage art. Posting all that and more that grabs my interest.

summary: IX Arts presents 'The Art Of Michael C Hayes', an online only art exhibition, featuring a mix of old and new artworks, as well...
caption:
IX Arts presents ‘The Art Of Michael C Hayes’, an online only art exhibition, featuring a mix of old and new artworks, as well as the premiere release of the originals for his charcoal portraits series.

The exhibition is on view until December 31 2018.

Go here to view the full exhibition of artwork.

summary: Lines I loved writing
title: Lines I loved writing
body:
@i-aim-to-overanalyze tagged me for the Lines I Loved Writing tag meme!

This was actually surprisingly difficult! My writing style involves extended metaphors and repeated motifs/themes over whole chapters/short stories, and sometimes even a ten-chapter fic all based around the same theme or motif. So lines do have impact, but only after reading what came before; like the last line of a poem might reveal a gem that amplifies or deepens the meaning of the previous lines.

For example, my recent fic for The Dragon Prince, Waiting in the Quiet, has six chapters so far and comprises a central theme of waiting - and no matter how I combed through it I couldn’t find anything that would make impact by itself, without drawing circle to another line or reference a few hundred words previous. So below are several short sections of a few of my fics which fall into a line-category.

The Silent Song, Chapter 35 - The Unifying Force:

Cold, bloodless fingers are curling in Qui-Gon’s sleeve, plaintively, and the Force flickers at their calling. Qui-Gon reverses his hand, grasps them tight, feels the barest spark of the Force flick from palm to palm.

“I have you,” Qui-Gon says, even though he does not, and he knows it.

Xanatos’s eyes are growing wet.

The Silent Song, Chapter 35 - The Unifying Force:

Obi-Wan cannot voice the words he wishes to tell the baby in his arms, but he leans close, and brushes his forehead across the much smaller one. In this moment, he wishes, with all his heart, all the joy and happiness and health and love he can upon this child.

Hello, Anakin Skywalker, he says in his mind, though there are none that know his words except for himself. It is lovely to meet you.

And though perhaps Obi-Wan does not know it, the Force has unified once more, as it has always done.

Silent Measures, Chapter 10 - Huei of Glee Anselm:

For the first time in his life, he is afraid of the sea; of diving into a dark, lightless ocean, never to rise to the surface again.

But then the Force buoys up under him like the shell of the Gampassa, long ago beyond the reach of his memory, and gives him a new master.

And the cycle brings him to the surface again, where the sunlight he cannot see is warm on his face, and lances through the Force to far-away Glee Anselm, where the Gampassa crosses oceans, and the sea-birds sing.

The Rain Curtain, Chapter 5 - Naboo Monsoon:

He detaches Qui-Gon’s lightsaber from his belt and activates it with a thumb slightly too slender for the crimson switch, holding the humming blade to the side with palms slightly too small to wrap securely around the rutted grooves, and fingers slightly too short to sense the true balance of the weapon. He will never be the giant of a man that was Qui-Gon, he knows; the hilt that he grasps will forever and always be for someone with more capable hands, and greater deeds.

The Rain Curtain, Chapter 8 - Landing at Point Rain:

He doesn’t know if they even hear his last shouted order to brace themselves; the gunship screams in an agony of contorted metal as it smashes into the rocky ground.

Obi-Wan screams with it in a silent inward howl, heart bleeding as twelve of those Force-lit flames are abruptly extinguished in a waterfall of icy death. He waits for the torrent to flood over him, too, to pull him under and hammer his bones into a caldera of melted durasteel…

…but it does not. Death breaks around Obi-Wan like rainwater in storm gully flowing around a support beam, and he is surrounded, but not drowned. It seems a common theme in his life, this. To be enclosed with death on all sides, but with his head just above it all, gasping, always seeming to be on the last dregs of sanity but hovering there, still alive.

The Rain Curtain, Chapter 9 - Storm of the Decade, Tatooine:

Obi-Wan is alone here, but he shouts anyway, throwing himself into the downpour. It is a shout that has been kept within him for ten long years; the howling remnant of You were my brother, the raw unending syllable at the end of I loved you.

He wonders if he looks like a madman; mad Ben Kenobi, wizard of the shifting sands.

Six-sentence prompt:

I’m emulating you, Obi-Wan,” Anakin groused, blinking rapidly against the painkillers. “I never see you staying in bed to heal.”

“You’ve won us quite the victory, Anakin,” - and there, that note of fond pride so rarely identified, as Obi-Wan placed a hand on Anakin’s brow - “Rest.”

Anakin’s dopey grin turned to furious betrayal as he recognised the sleep suggestion, but Ahsoka wasn’t looking at him - instead she stared as Master Kenobi nudged Anakin to sleep, and she saw, for a moment, a young Knight with a small Padawan, and a hundred words unsaid; only felt.

Tagging @elfpen, @qwertyuiop678, @pandora15 (and I’ve probably forgotten some people, soz) Thanks for the tag!

Fanfic masterlist

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

summary: I wanted to draw my beautiful Sith Warrior Fenra’ke in a hot new outfit, so I decided to draw my SWTOR characters chibi and in...
caption:
I wanted to draw my beautiful Sith Warrior Fenra’ke in a hot new outfit, so I decided to draw my SWTOR characters chibi and in new clothes, cuz I CAN’T get enough of fashion design!

Here’s Sith Warrior Fenra’ke, Smuggler Ko’neesh, and Jedi Consular Saveesa!

||Commission Info || My Patreon at ChocolatePyrusArt|| Kofi at ChoPyArt ||

blog.name: ao3feed-starwars
blog.title: Star Wars AO3 Feed
blog.description:
An AO3 Feed for the Star Wars - All Media Types tag.

Icon from the Star Wars App.

summary: Friendship Test 2: The Book of Love and Friendship
title: Friendship Test 2: The Book of Love and Friendship
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2DWloBQ

by Aggimagination

The sequel of ‘Friendship test’, 10 years later. One year later, after their last wager, La Muerte and Xibalba set another wager of which of them has the right opinion about humans/mortals. The unexpected wager gone crazy when a mortal human girl from another world came, and turned the Land of the Forgotten upside down.

Words: 1697, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Book of Life (2014), Penguins of Madagascar, The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993), Winnie-the-Pooh - All Media Types, Fairly OddParents, Powerpuff Girls, Angry Birds - All Media Types, A.N.T. Farm, Tom and Jerry (MGM/Hanna-Barbera), Kid vs. Kat (TV), Oggy and the Cockroaches (Cartoon), Phineas and Ferb, Tinker Bell (Movies), Jake and the Never Land Pirates, Looney Tunes | Merrie Melodies, Hannah Montana (TV), FRED (Web Series), Combo Niños (Cartoon), Star Wars Original Trilogy, Yin Yang Yo!, Turbo FAST, My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic, Chicken Run (2000), Codename: Kids Next Door, Shaun the Sheep (Cartoon), Dog with a Blog, Hotel Transylvania (Movies), Zootopia (2016), The Great Mouse Detective (1986), Storks (2016), Danger Mouse (TV), Les Schtroumpfs | The Smurfs
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: Gen
  • Characters: La Muerte (Book of Life), Xibalba (Book of Life), OC - Character, Candle Maker (Book of Life), Chakal (Book of Life)
  • Relationships: La Muerte/Xibalba (Book of Life)
  • Additional Tags: Musicals, Friendship, Dimension Travel, Bets & Wagers, Magic


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2DWloBQ

by Aggimagination

The sequel of ‘Friendship test’, 10 years later. One year later, after their last wager, La Muerte and Xibalba set another wager of which of them has the right opinion about humans/mortals. The unexpected wager gone crazy when a mortal human girl from another world came, and turned the Land of the Forgotten upside down.

Words: 1697, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Book of Life (2014), Penguins of Madagascar, The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993), Winnie-the-Pooh - All Media Types, Fairly OddParents, Powerpuff Girls, Angry Birds - All Media Types, A.N.T.
